Empowering Women Through Enterprise, Livelihood & Leadership

By Aikya Seva Centre

In rural Maharashtra, women are leading the charge toward transformation. With support from Aikya Seva Centre, they’re managing oil refineries, growing their own food, raising livestock, hosting educational events, and inspiring others. This blog highlights their powerful journey.

Women-Led Oil Refinery: Panoli’s Pride

The oil refinery project in Panoli is a model of women-led entrepreneurship. Equipped with cold press oil machines, the women extract oil from sunflower seeds and beans. They then sell this oil through a dedicated retail store run entirely by the community’s women.

They’ve learned business planning, quality control, pricing, and customer handling — truly running a grassroots rural enterprise. This has increased confidence, income, and status for the women of Panoli.

Mahila Melava (Women’s Gatherings)

Melavas are spaces of joy, knowledge, and strength. Here, women meet, celebrate progress, share stories, and grow together through fun activities and exposure sessions.

Mahila Melava events foster bonding, leadership, and celebration

Exposure Visits & Learning

Rural women visited successful model villages and enterprises, learning new practices and bringing inspiration home. This helps them replicate success in their own communities.

Kitchen Gardens, Goats & Hens

Over 120 women now grow vegetables in backyard gardens. Along with this, chickens and goats were distributed as part of side-income programs, empowering women to support their families better. Many of them now sell eggs, milk, and organic vegetables locally.

Distributing Veggie plants for their Kitchen Gardens

Goat & Poultry Distribution

Nutrition, income, and empowerment from sustainable practices

Impact Summary

  • Oil refinery run entirely by village women
  • 120+ kitchen gardens and 60+ livestock units established
  • Mahila Melava events held across 5 regions
  • 10+ exposure visits and field learnings

These are stories of resilience. From food to finance, from exposure to enterprise — the women of rural Maharashtra are rewriting futures. Together. Confidently. Sustainably.
